channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
item.description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

item.title: O'Neill returns to Celtic for rest of season
item.description: Martin O'Neill is returning to Celtic as manager for the remainder of the season following the dismissal of Wilfried Nancy.

item.title: Stop experiments and get manager who fits Man Utd DNA - Neville
item.description: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to 'stop experimenting' and appoint a manager who fits the club's DNA after Ruben Amorim was sacked on Monday.

item.title: 'Appointing Nancy one of clueless Celtic's greatest blunders'
item.description: There is "no apparent big picture view at Celtic", argues BBC Sport Scotland's Tom English as Wilfried Nancy and Paul Tisdale exit the ailing champions.

item.title: 'Amorim's toxic exit the latest chaotic chapter in Ratcliffe's reign'
item.description: Ruben Amorim's acrimonious exit is the latest example of Manchester United's chaos and instability under Sir Jim Ratcliffe, says Phil McNulty.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Tony McGuinness of Above and Beyond
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Tony McGuinness of Above and Beyond - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Man City's Gvardiol to have surgery on broken shinbone
item.description: Manchester City defender Josko Gvardiol will have surgery later this week after breaking his shinbone during Sunday's 1-1 Premier League draw with Chelsea.

item.title: Sheffield United deny deliberately delaying Cusack inquest
item.description: Sheffield United deny deliberately delaying the inquest into the death of their former women's team captain Maddy Cusack.

item.title: How Nancy's calamitous 33-day reign unfolded at Celtic
item.description: BBC Sport takes an amble through Wilfried Nancy's short tenure as Celtic manager.

item.title: Man City increase interest in Palace captain Guehi
item.description: Manchester City are emerging as contenders to sign Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi in January following injuries to defenders Josko Gvardiol and Ruben Dias.

item.title: The ups and downs of Amorim's reign in five matches
item.description: BBC Sport looks at five Premier League matches which underline the ups and downs of Ruben Amorim's 14-month reign at Manchester United.

item.title: Man Utd can't keep sacking managers - Bosnich
item.description: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Mark Bosnich says the fans want clarity and to know what is going on behind the scenes after the club sacked head coach Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Man Utd fan says Southgate the 'manager I don't want'
item.description: After sacking Ruben Amorim, might Manchester United co-owners INEOS consider approaching former England manager Gareth Southgate with a view to steadying the ship?

item.title: Rosenior as good a coach as I've ever worked with - Rooney
item.description: With Liam Rosenior in talks to fill the vacant manager's role at Chelsea, Wayne Rooney speaks on his former Derby County colleague and explains why he thinks Rosenior deserves to manage in the Premier League.

item.title: The man carrying the creative burden at Man Utd
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Gary O'Neil breaks down Matheus Cunha's solid performance for Manchester United and ultimate equaliser against Leeds United.

item.title: Who could be the next permanent Man Utd manager?
item.description: A former Manchester United player? A current Premier League manager? An overseas coach? BBC Sport looks at the possible replacements for Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Newcastle contact police after Willock receives racist abuse
item.description: Newcastle United contact the police after midfielder Joe Willock is the subject of "disgusting" racial abuse and "deeply disturbing threats" online.

item.title: West Ham sign Argentina striker Castellanos
item.description: Valentin 'Taty' Castellanos says he will bring his "fighting spirit" to West Ham after joining from Lazio on a four-and-a-half-year deal.

item.title: Rice, Watkins & Cunha make cut - FPL team of the week
item.description: Erling Haaland retains the captaincy despite his run of blanks but, if he fails to score against Brighton, FPL managers can start to panic.

item.title: Leicester City sign Swede Jansson from Rosengard
item.description: Leicester City sign midfielder Emma Jansson on a two-and-a-half-year deal from Swedish side FC Rosengard.

item.title: Rosenior deserves Chelsea chance, says Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney says Liam Rosenior is as good a coach as he has worked with and deserves the chance to be Chelsea manager.

item.title: City held at home as Chelsea snatch stoppage‑time equaliser
item.description: Enzo Fernandez scores a stoppage-time equaliser as Chelsea end a tumultuous week by claiming a worthy Premier League point at title-chasing Manchester City.

item.title: Leeds denied win as Cunha hits back for Man Utd
item.description: Brenden Aaronson breaks the deadlock, before Matheus Cunha levels just three minutes later, as Leeds and Manchester United share the points at Elland road.

item.title: Brentford surge past Everton with thrilling second‑half display
item.description: Igor Thiago scores a hat-trick to end his brief goal drought, as Brentford leapfrog Everton in the Premier League with a comfortable victory at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

item.title: Reed's stoppage‑time strike earns Fulham dramatic draw with Liverpool
item.description: Harrison Reed's superb 97th-minute equaliser earns the hosts a dramatic point, cancelling out Cody Gakpo's goal from just three minutes earlier, as Fulham deny a Liverpool comeback in a Premier League thriller.

item.title: Brilliant Brobbey goal earns Sunderland late draw as Spurs booed
item.description: Sunderland increase the pressure on Tottenham Hotspur head coach Thomas Frank as Brian Brobbey's late equaliser gives the Black Cats a point.

item.title: Second‑half lift sees Newcastle ease past Palace
item.description: Newcastle United climb to ninth in the table, as captain Bruno Guimaraes inspires the hosts to victory with a hard-fought win over Crystal Palace at St James' Park.

item.title: How does Amorim's record compare to other Man Utd managers?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Ruben Amorim's record as a Manchester United manager and how it compares to other previous bosses

item.title: Can you name every Man Utd boss since Ferguson?
item.description: With Ruben Amorim leaving, we ask: Can you name every manager or head coach to lead Manchester United since Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement in 2013?

item.title: Celtic sack manager Nancy after eight games
item.description: Celtic sack manager Wilfried Nancy after just 33 days in charge - with head of football operations Paul Tisdale also dismissed.

item.title: Amorim sacked by Man Utd after 14 months in charge
item.description: Manchester United sack manager Ruben Amorim after he criticised the club's hierarchy following Sunday's 1-1 draw at Leeds.

item.title: Arsenal sign Sweden teenager Holmberg
item.description: Eighteen-year-old defender Smilla Holmberg says "it's always been my dream to play for Arsenal" after signing a long-term contract.

item.title: Can you name the Premier League's oldest ever players?
item.description: James Milner could make a Premier League appearance after his 40th birthday on Wednesday. Can you name the other 18 players to have done so?

item.title: Aberdeen links 'don't turn' Robinson's head
item.description: Stephen Robinson says it's "nice" to be linked with the vacant Aberdeen job, but insists his sole focus is on St Mirren's Scottish Premiership trip to Livingston on Tuesday.

item.title: Real Madrid join Wharton race - Monday's gossip
item.description: Adam Wharton emerges as a target for Real Madrid, Crystal Palace are assessing several options, AC Milan are keeping tabs on Nathan Ake, plus more.

item.title: Martindale has Livingston owner's 'full support'
item.description: Livingston chairman Calvin Ford insists manager David Martindale has his "full support" despite the club's struggles this season.

item.title: Ex-Burnley and England keeper McDonald dies aged 95
item.description: Former Burnley goalkeeper Colin McDonald, who also played eight times for England, including at the 1958 World Cup, dies aged 95.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Spurs sign 'dynamic' Blakstad on permanent deal
item.description: Head coach Martin Ho describes the 24-year-old Norway international as a "dynamic full-back".

item.title: 'I was sure it was offside' - why did Wirtz equaliser stand?
item.description: Florian Wirtz thought his goal for Liverpool in the 2-2 draw at Fulham was offside - so how did technology allow it to stand?

item.title: Are in-form Wrexham really dreaming of a fourth promotion?
item.description: Wrexham are a point off the Championship play-off spots, raising the prospect of another promotion - this time to the Premier League.

item.title: 'Struggling Frank trapped in gilded cage at joyless Tottenham'
item.description: Struggling head coach Thomas Frank is trapped in a gilded cage at joyless Tottenham Hotspur, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Thelin 'accepts' Aberdeen sacking after winless run
item.description: Aberdeen sack manager Jimmy Thelin following a five-match winless run and just eight months on from the club's Scottish Cup win.

item.title: 'A chance' Chelsea will name new boss on Monday as Rosenior jets in
item.description: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior arrives in London for talks about replacing Enzo Maresca as Chelsea head coach.

item.title: Could Liverpool have stopped Reed's 'unbelievable' goal?
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses Harrison Reed's superb late goal that rescued a point for Fulham as Gary O'Neil highlights his disappointment with Liverpool's defence.

item.title: I will do my job for 18 months and then we move on - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says that in 18 months' time, when his contract is due to end, he will leave, repeatedly stating that he came to "manage" the club, not just to be a coach.

item.title: 'Maybe you know better than me!' - Guardiola defends performance
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says how his side defended and played outside the final third was "extraordinary" and disagrees with Man City having a lack of momentum after failing to secure a second goal in a 1-1 draw against managerless Chelsea at the Etihad.

item.title: Real Madrid youngster Garcia scores hat-trick in place of Mbappe
item.description: Watch highlights as Real Madrid beat Real Betis 5-1, with 21-year-old striker Gonzalo Garcia, starting in place of the injured Kylian Mbappe, scoring a hat-trick.

item.title: Expected Chelsea boss Rosenior has 'served his apprenticeship'
item.description: Match of the Day pundits discuss the expected appointment of Liam Rosenior as Chelsea head coach following the departure of Enzo Maresca amid internal tensions at the club.

item.title: 'I needed them and they were there' - when young players find new homes
item.description: BBC Sport explores how young footballers build bonds with second families when they leave home to sign for a new club on their path to the top.

item.title: Leeds 'devastated' as fan dies at game with Man Utd
item.description: Leeds United say they are "devastated" after a supporter died before their Premier League game against Manchester United on Sunday.

item.title: Wrexham striker Mullin's Wigan loan cut short
item.description: Paul Mullin will return to the Stok Cae Ras this week after his season-long loan with League One Wigan Athletic was terminated early.

item.title: Rangers' Sterling charged over crash after Old Firm game
item.description: Police said no-one was injured in the incident and the defender will appear in court at a later date.

item.title: Chelsea have shown character through manager changes - McFarlane
item.description: Interim manager Calum McFarlane credits the leaders in the Chelsea dressing room for the character they have shown through a tumultuous week which saw manager Enzo Maresca sacked.

item.title: Reed deserves credit for a moment of 'pure inspiration'- Silva
item.description: Fulham manager Marco Silva reacts to his team's 2-2 draw against Liverpool with Harrison Reed scoring a stunning 97th-minute equaliser in a moment of "pure inspiration".

item.title: 'It's not enough'- Slot frustrated with Fulham draw
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "it's not enough" for his side to rely on late goals after a "frustrating" 2-2 draw against Fulham at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Beating Palace 'a big step forward' - Howe
item.description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says his team's 2-0 win over Crystal Palace represents "a big step forward", as The Magpies look to build momentum in their Premier League season.

item.title: Palace vulnerability to set-pieces a big issue - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner criticises his side's inability to defend set-pieces after their 2-0 defeat at Newcastle United. Palace are without a win in seven games in all competitions.

item.title: 11 EFL players who could be on the move in January
item.description: BBC Sport examines some of the leading talent in the EFL likely to be subject to interest and offers over the January transfer window.

item.title: What went wrong between Chelsea and Maresca?
item.description: Less than six months after guiding Chelsea to Club World Cup success, Enzo Maresca has left. But how did things unravel?

item.title: Who might be on move in January in WSL?
item.description: With the January transfer window opening in the Women's Super League, which players could be on the move and who is out of contract?

item.title: How does Maresca's Chelsea record compare?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Enzo Maresca's records as Chelsea manager and how it compared to previous bosses.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How is Premier League doing in race for five Champions League places?
item.description: With the top three in the Premier League pulling away, could fifth be enough for Champions League football again?

item.title: McFarlane to take on Guardiola - but who is he?
item.description: Chelsea Under-21 head coach Calum McFarlane is set to take charge of the Premier League trip to Manchester City.

item.title: Why is the Dundee derby not part of the 3pm blackout?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why the Dundee derby is being shown on TV despite the 3pm blackout.

item.title: Who is Bendito Mantato? Man Utd debutant profiled
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Manchester United teenager Bendito Mantato, who made his senior debut against Wolves in United's final match of 2025

item.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: 'Rangers building something with real togetherness'
item.description: As Rangers bid to go second in the Scottish Premiership, defender John Souttar says everyone at Ibrox can feel momentum, while manager Danny Rohl confirms Dujon Sterling is available to face Aberdeen after being charged with driving offences.

item.title: 'A lot of people' let Thelin down - Leven
item.description: Sacked Aberdeen manager Jimmy Thelin was let down by "a lot of people" but did not lose the Pittodrie dressing room, according to interim boss Peter Leven.

item.title: Public holiday to celebrate Scotland's World Cup return
item.description: Scotland will face Haiti in Boston on Sunday 14 June before taking on Morocco and Brazil in the US.

item.title: Morning pitch inspection for Livingston v St Mirren
item.description: Tuesday's Scottish Premiership game between Livingston and St Mirren is subject to a 10:30 GMT pitch inspection following freezing weather in West Lothian.

item.title: 'Neilson set for further Kilmarnock talks' - gossip
item.description: Kilmarnock reportedly move closer to a managerial appointment, Rangers are yet to bid for Belgian left-back and Israel-based winger is close to joining Celtic.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Every WSL January transfer signing
item.description: All the confirmed transfers involving WSL clubs in the January window.

item.title: Spurs sign Chelsea's Hamano on loan until June
item.description: Tottenham complete the signing of Chelsea's Maika Hamano on loan until the end of the season.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
